items.name: Adaptability
items.description: When this Pokémon uses a move of its own type, it may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Aftermath
items.description: This Pokémon deals damage to an attacker equal to half of the damage received when knocked out by a melee move.

items.name: Air Lock
items.description: While this Pokémon is in battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.

items.name: Air Slash
items.description: This Pokémon knows Air Slash as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

items.name: Analytic
items.description: After this Pokémon misses an attack, its next attack is done at advantage.

items.name: Anger Point
items.description: After suffering a critical hit, this Pokémon doubles the damage dice for a single move it activates on the following turn.

items.name: Anger Shell
items.description: When this Pokémon's HP drops below half its maximum HP, its AC drops by 2, but its STR and DEX scores each increase by 2, up to a maximum of 22. After a long rest, this Pokémon's AC, STR, and DEX return to their former values.

items.name: Anticipation
items.description: When this Pokémon enters the battle, an opponent must reveal if it has a move that the Pokémon is vulnerable to. The move itself does not have to be revealed, only that there is such a move.

items.name: Arena Trap
items.description: Grounded creatures within 50 feet of this Pokémon may not flee or switch out, except by item, Move, or ability.

items.name: Aroma Veil
items.description: Any ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon automatically passes any WIS save they are required to make.

items.name: As One
items.description: Opponents in combat with this Pokémon cannot eat held berries. Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon may immediately move up to 20ft take another action. This ability cannot be swapped off this Pokémon.

items.name: Aura Break
items.description: When this Pokémon is in battle, the boost of Fairy Aura and Dark Aura abilities is reversed, Any applicable move type activated within 100 feet deals half damage instead of double.

items.name: Bad Dreams
items.description: If an opponent in battle with this Pokémon falls asleep, they take an amount of damage equal to this Pokémon's proficeincy bonus at the end of each of their turns.

items.name: Ball Fetch
items.description: This Pokémon has advantage catching or intercepting thrown/falling objects.

items.name: Battery
items.description: Allies that activate electric-type moves within 20 feet of this Pokémon double their damage dice.

items.name: Battle Armor
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.

items.name: Beast Boost
items.description: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

items.name: Berserk
items.description: When this Pokémon falls below 25% of its maximum health, all of its attacks are rolled with disadvantage, but deal double their damage. If a move activated requires a saving throw, the target(s) have advantage on the roll.

items.name: Big Pecks
items.description: This Pokémon's AC cannot be reduced by an opponent's moves.

items.name: Blaze
items.description: This Pokémon doubles its STAB bonus when it has 25% or less of its maximum health.

items.name: Blizzard
items.description: This Pokémon knows Blizzard as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

items.name: Bulletproof
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to damage from moves with Bullet, Ball, or Bomb in their name.

items.name: Cheek Pouch
items.description: When this Pokémon eats any type of berry, is heals for an additional 10% of its maximum HP (rounded up to the nearest whole number).

items.name: Chilling Neigh
items.description: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon may immediately move up to 20ft take another action.

items.name: Chlorophyll
items.description: This Pokémon’s speed is doubled in harsh sunlight.

items.name: Clear Body
items.description: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.

items.name: Cloud Nine
items.description: While this Pokémon is in battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.

items.name: Color Change
items.description: When hit by a damaging attack, this Pokémon's type changes to the type that hit it. It takes on the new type's resistances, vulnerabilities, and immunities.

items.name: Comatose
items.description: This Pokémon is in a continuous state of drowsiness. It is immune to the sleep condition, but is considered affected by sleep for all moves that require a Pokémon to be asleep to use or activate additional effects (Snore, Sleep Talk, Wake-Up Slap, Dream Eater, etc.)

items.name: Competitive
items.description: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage rolls while poisoned, burned, confused, or paralyzed.

items.name: Compound Eyes
items.description: This Pokémon gets an additional +1 to attack rolls.

items.name: Contrary
items.description: Moves that affect this Pokémon's stats have the opposite effect. (For example, Defense Curl would lower AC by 4. Growl would increase its attack by +1)

items.name: Corrosion
items.description: This Pokémon's moves ignore the poison immunity of creatures granted by their Pokémon type, and can inflict the poisoned status on poison and steel type creatures. If the target’s secondary type gives it vulnerability or resistance to the damage, it follows the secondary type for that effect.

items.name: Cotton Down
items.description: When this Pokémon is damaged, cotton spews everywhere. The area within 10ft of this Pokémon becomes difficult terrain for everything except Grass monotypes until the beginning of its next turn.

items.name: Curious Medicine
items.description: As a bonus action, this Pokémon can reset changes to the ability scores, AC, and attack modifier of either itself or an ally within 30 ft. This Pokémon may do this a number of times equal to its INT modifier (minimum of once), and it resets on a long rest.

items.name: Cursed Body
items.description: When hit by a melee attack, this Pokémon may roll 1d4. On a result of 4, the opponent who made the attack cannot use the same move on its next turn.

items.name: Cute Charm
items.description: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.

items.name: Damp
items.description: This Pokémon is unaffected by Self Destruct and Explosion moves.

items.name: Dancer
items.description: If any creature within sight of this Pokémon activates a move with Dance in its name, this Pokémon may immediately use one of its moves as a reaction.

items.name: Dark Aura
items.description: When this Pokémon is in battle, all dark-type moves by allies or opponents within 100 feet deal double their damage.

items.name: Dauntless Shield
items.description: Melee attacks made against this Pokémon have disadvantage.

items.name: Dazzling
items.description: Creatures within line of sight of this Pokémon cannot use bonus actions to activate Moves. Moves that would normally have a Move Time of "1 bonus action" instead have a Move Time of "1 action".

items.name: Defeatist
items.description: When this Pokémon drops below 25% of its maximum HP, all of its attacks are rolled with disadvantage.

items.name: Defiant
items.description: While this Pokémon is suffering from a negative status effect or stat change imposed by an opponent, it gains +2 to all attack rolls.

items.name: Disguise
items.description: This Pokémon has a disguise which gives it a temporary hp boost equal to twice its level. When the temporary hit points fall to zero, the disguise breaks and requires a short rest to repair.

items.name: Download
items.description: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can choose a different damage type for one of their normal attacks.

items.name: Dragon's Maw
items.description: When this Pokémon uses a dragon-type move, it may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Drifter
items.description: In windy conditions (DM discretion), this Pokémon's flying (hover) speed is doubled until windy conditions cease.

items.name: Drizzle
items.description: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to light rain for 5 rounds. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

items.name: Drought
items.description: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to bright sunlight for 5 rounds. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

items.name: Dry Skin
items.description: At the end of each of this Pokémon's turns, it takes an amount of damage equal to its proficiency modifier in harsh sunlight, or heals for the same amount during rain.

items.name: Early Bird
items.description: This Pokémon has advantage on rolls to wake from sleep.

items.name: Effect Spore
items.description: When hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of grass damage equal to your proficiency modifier to your attacker.

items.name: Electric Surge
items.description: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Electric Terrain move as a bonus action.

items.name: Electromorphosis
items.description: When this Pokémon takes damage, it may double the MOVE damage modifier of its next electric-type move.

items.name: Emergency Exit
items.description: At any time this Pokémon is damaged when it is at or below 50% of its maximum HP, its trainer may switch it out as a free action.

items.name: Fairy Aura
items.description: When this Pokémon is in battle, all fairy-type moves within 100 feet of you deal double their damage.

items.name: Filter
items.description: When hit by a move type this Pokémon is vulnerable to, it may roll a d4. In a result of 4, it does not take the additional damage.

items.name: Flame Body
items.description: The flames from this Pokémon's body shine dim light in a 15 ft radius. In addition, when hit by a melee attack, roll a d10. On a 10, the attacker is burned.

items.name: Flare Boost
items.description: This Pokémon adds proficiency to its damage rolls while burned.

items.name: Flash Fire
items.description: This Pokémon takes no damage from fire or fire-type attacks. Instead, immediately after taking a hit from a fire-type move, or in open flames, double the STAB bonus on the next fire-type move.

items.name: Flower Gift
items.description: During harsh sunlight, ally Pokémon within 30 feet of this Pokémon add their proficiency bonus to damage rolls.

items.name: Flower Veil
items.description: Any grass-type ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to new status effects.

items.name: Fluffy
items.description: This Pokemon is vulnerable to fire-type moves, but takes half damage from any melee attack (that isn't fire-type).

items.name: Forecast
items.description: This Pokémon changes form with the weather. In rain it becomes water-type, in harsh sunlight it becomes fire-type, in cold and snowy conditions it becomes ice-type. In all other conditions it is normal-type. Its STAB, resistance, immunities, and vulnerabilities change to match the form it takes.

items.name: Forewarn
items.description: When this Pokémon enters battle, it selects a target to reveal the move it knows with the most damage output. In the case of a tie, the target can choose which move it reveals.

items.name: Form Change (Arceus)
items.description: Arceus' default type is Normal. It can change its type by holding an Elemental Plate. While holding this plate, the signature move, Judgment, also changes its type to match Arceus. These plates are: Draco (Dragon), Dread (Dark), Earth (Ground), Fist (Fighting), Flame (Fire), Icicle (Ice), Insect (Bug), Iron (Steel), Meadow (Grass), Mind (Psychic), Pixie (Fairy), Sky (Flying), Splash (Water), Spooky (Ghost), Stone (Rock), Toxic (Poison), and Zap (Electric).

items.name: Form Change (Cherrim)
items.description: Cherrim changes appearance depending on the weather. In strong sunlight, it blossoms into Sunshine Form.

items.name: Form Change (Giratina)
items.description: Giratina's default form is Altered Forme. When it is given a Griseous Orb to hold, or any time it is in its home plane, the Distortion World, it takes on the Origin Forme.

items.name: Form Change (Hoopa)
items.description: When holding the Prison Bottle, Hoopa Confined changes form to Hoopa Unbound.

items.name: Form Change (Keldeo)
items.description: Keldeo's standard form is Ordinary Form. When it learns the move Secret Sword, it changes into Resolute Form as long as the move is in its move list.

items.name: Form Change (Kyurem)
items.description: While in the presence of a willing Reshiram or Zekrom, Kyurem can fuse with one of the willing Pokemon, at will, with the help of a DNA Splicer. This process is called Absofusion and will result in a White Kyurem (if fused with Reshiram) or Black Kyurem (if fused with Zekrom).

items.name: Form Change (Meloetta)
items.description: As long as Meloetta is outside of battle, it assumes Aria Forme. When the move Relic Song is used, Meloettta interchanges between Aria Forme and Pirouette Forme.

items.name: Form Change (Necrozma)
items.description: Necrozma can fuse with a willing Solgaleo, at will, with the help of the N-Solarizer, or Lunala with the help of the N-Lunarizer. The fusion will result in a Dusk Mane Necrozma (if fused with Solgaleo) or Dawn Wings Necrozma (if fused with Lunala) with the same current HP.

items.name: Form Change (Oricorio)
items.description: This Pokémon's form can change by giving it a certain kind of Nectar. Red Nectar changes it to Baile Style, Pink Nectar changes it to Pa'u Style, Purple Nectar changes it to Sensu Style, and Yellow Nectar changes it to Pom-Pom Style.

items.name: Form Change (Rotom)
items.description: Rotom has 5 alternate forms that it can take when it is near a household appliance. As a bonus action, Rotom can take the Heat Form, Wash Form, Frost Form, Fan Form, or Mow Form, changing its typing and stats. The form is dependent on the type of appliance it possesses (DM Discretion). separate stat blocks are provided for each form.

items.name: Form Change (Shaymin)
items.description: Shaymin's default form is Land. When Given a Gracidea Flower to hold, it can change to Sky Form, taking on new typing, statistics, and moves

items.name: Form Change (Ultra Necrozma)
items.description: This Pokémon can transform into Ultra Necrozma as a bonus action on its turn. When it does, the transformation is treated as a permanent mega evolution, following the rules as stated in the Pokémon 5e Player Handbook.

items.name: Friend Guard
items.description: Once per long rest, when an ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is hit by an attack, it may choose to halve the damage dealt.

items.name: Frisk
items.description: Upon entering a battle, a single opponent’s held item is revealed, if it has one.

items.name: Full Metal Body
items.description: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.

items.name: Fur Coat
items.description: Once per long rest, this Pokémon may halve the damage dealt to it from any one attack.

items.name: Gale Wings
items.description: This Pokémon adds an additional +1 to hit when using flying-type attacks.

items.name: Galvanize
items.description: All of this Pokémon's normal-type moves are electric-type.

items.name: Gluttony
items.description: This Pokémon must eat its held berry when it falls below ½ of its maximum HP.

items.name: Gooey
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit with a melee attack, roll 1d4. On a result of 3 or 4, the attacker's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Gorilla Tactics
items.description: When this Pokémon enters the battlefield, choose one of its moves. Double the MOVE damage modifier for the selected move; the MOVE damage modifier for this Pokémon's other moves becomes 0. The effect resets when this Pokémon leaves the battlefield.

items.name: Grass Pelt
items.description: This Pokémon gains +1 to AC while in grassy terrain.

items.name: Grassy Surge
items.description: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Grassy Terrain move as a bonus action.

items.name: Grim Neigh
items.description: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon may immediately move up to 20ft take another action.

items.name: Guard Dog
items.description: This Pokémon cannot be forcibly switched out by other moves. Intimidation rolls made against this Pokémon have disadvantage. This Pokémon is unaffected by the Intimidate ability.

items.name: Gulp Missile
items.description: May Grapple as a bonus action after completing either Surf or Dive. As a bonus action, may launch a creature grappled by you up to 15ft, dealing fall damage equivalent to the distance launched.

items.name: Guts
items.description: When this Pokémon is burned or poisoned, they are not affected by the disadvantage or reduced damage effects. They still take damage at the end of each of their turns.

items.name: Harvest
items.description: At the end of this Pokémon's turn, if it used a berry, roll 1d4. On a result of 3 or 4, it regains that berry as a held item.

items.name: Healer
items.description: As an action, this Pokemon may touch a creature to heal poison, burn, or paralysis. When it uses this ability, roll a d4. On the a result of 1 or 2, the status effect is moved to itself.

items.name: Heatproof
items.description: This Pokemon takes half the damage it otherwise would from Fire damage, and is immune to the burning condition.

items.name: Heavy Metal
items.description: This Pokémon is especially heavy. Once per long rest, after being targeted by an attack, it may increase its AC by 2 if it would cause an attack to miss.

items.name: Honey Gather
items.description: At the end of each battle, this Pokémon may roll a d20 + its proficiency bonus. On a result of 20 or higher, its trainer adds a Honey to their inventory.

items.name: Huge Power
items.description: Once per short rest, this Pokémon may double the damage dice for a single damage roll. The player must announce that they are using this ability before the attack roll.

items.name: Hunger Switch
items.description: At the start of its turn, this Pokemon switches to Hangry Mode if it was in Full Belly Mode, or switches to Full Belly Mode if it was in Hangry Mode.

items.name: Hustle
items.description: When you score a critical hit, you may immediately gain an additional action on your turn. If this action is used to make an attack, you have disadvantage on the roll. You may only ever have one additional action per round.

items.name: Hydration
items.description: This Pokémon is unaffected by negative status ailments in water or during rainy conditions.

items.name: Hydro Pump
items.description: This Pokémon knows Hydro Pump as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

items.name: Hyper Cutter
items.description: This Pokémon’s attack or damage bonuses cannot be decreased by an opponent’s moves.

items.name: Ice Body
items.description: While it is snowing or hailing, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency modifier at the end of each of its turns.

items.name: Ice Face
items.description: This Pokémon has two forms: Ice Form and No-Ice Form. When in Ice Form, the first time this pokémon takes damage, it takes half that damage but transforms into No-Ice Form. When in No-Ice Form, this pokemon's AC is decreased by 3 and each of its movement speeds are increased by 5 ft. This Pokémon reverts back to Ice Form after a short rest, or on the start of its turn when in the hail.

items.name: Ice Scales
items.description: This Pokémon has resistance to damange dealt by moves whose power is one of INT, WIS, or CHA.

items.name: Illuminate
items.description: This Pokémon knows the Light cantrip and can cast it at will.

items.name: Illusion
items.description: This Pokémon can take the visual form of any Pokémon it can see. It can do this a number of times per long rest equal to its level. This illusion lasts for one hour or until the Pokémon is hit by a damaging move.

items.name: Immunity
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to becoming poisoned.

items.name: Imposter
items.description: This Pokémon can use Transform as a bonus action.

items.name: Infiltrator
items.description: This Pokémon bypasses Light Screen, Reflect, Substitute, Mist, Safeguard, and Aurora Veil.

items.name: Innards Out
items.description: When this Pokémon is knocked out by a damaging move, the attacker takes an amount of typeless damage equal to the amount of HP lost.

items.name: Inner Focus
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.

items.name: Insomnia
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to sleep.

items.name: Intimidate
items.description: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.

items.name: Intrepid Sword
items.description: This Pokémon makes melee attacks with advantage.

items.name: Iron Barbs
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, it may roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of steel damage equal to its proficiency modifier to its attacker.

items.name: Iron Fist
items.description: When attacking with a punch-based move (Mega Punch, Dynamic Punch, Ice/Fire/Thunder Punch, etc.), this Pokémon may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Justified
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a dark-type move, it gets advantage on its next attack.

items.name: Keen Eye
items.description: This Pokémon ignores disadvantage when it relates to sight.

items.name: Klutz
items.description: This Pokémon cannot hold an item.

items.name: Leaf Guard
items.description: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in harsh sunlight.

items.name: Leaf Storm
items.description: This Pokémon knows Leaf Storm as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

items.name: Levitate
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to ground moves.

items.name: Libero
items.description: While executing a move, this Pokémon's type becomes the same as that of the move and may add its STAB bonus to it.

items.name: Light Metal
items.description: This Pokémon is especially light for its species. Once per long rest, it may impose disadvantage on an attack roll against it.

items.name: Lightning Rod
items.description: If this Pokemon or an ally within 30 feet is targeted with a direct electric-type, damage-dealing move, the Pokemon may use a reaction to redirect the target to itself and take half damage from it if it hits.

items.name: Limber
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to being paralyzed.

items.name: Lingering Aroma
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack or hits with a melee attack, one random ability of its attacker changes to Lingering Aroma until the end of the encounter or until switched out.

items.name: Liquid Ooze
items.description: If an enemy uses a leeching or absorb move against this Pokémon, the Pokémon must make a DC 12 CON save or become poisoned.

items.name: Liquid Voice
items.description: Any sound-based move activated by this Pokémon is water-type.

items.name: Long Reach
items.description: This Pokémon has an additional 5 feet of reach with all melee attacks and Attacks of Opportunity.

items.name: Magic Bounce
items.description: Once per long rest, when succumbing to a negative status effect, this Pokémon can instead reflect the effect back on the attacker.

items.name: Magic Guard
items.description: If this Pokémon is subjected to a move that forces it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage on a success.

items.name: Magician
items.description: If not already holding an item, this Pokémon steals the held item of any Pokémon it hits with a melee attack.

items.name: Magma Armor
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to freezing.

items.name: Magnet Pull
items.description: Steel opponents in battle with this Pokémon may not switch out or flee.

items.name: Marvel Scale
items.description: This Pokémon's AC increase by 2 when suffering from a negative status condition.

items.name: Mega Launcher
items.description: Aura and Pulse moves made by this Pokémon deal additional damage/healing equal to this Pokémon's proficiency bonus.

items.name: Merciless
items.description: This Pokémon doubles their damage dice when dealing damage to an opponent that is poisoned.

items.name: Mimicry
items.description: This Pokémon's type changes depending on the terrain. If a Terrain move is active, this Pokémon's type becomes the Terrain move's type. This Pokémon's type reverts once the Terrain move deactivates.

items.name: Minus
items.description: This Pokémon boosts its attack and damage rolls by 2 if an ally also has a Plus or Minus ability

items.name: Mirror Armor
items.description: When affected by an effect that lowers this Pokémon's attack roll, AC, movement, or ability scores, the same effect is applied to the source (if applicable).

items.name: Misty Surge
items.description: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Misty Terrain move as a bonus action.

items.name: Mold Breaker
items.description: This Pokémon's moves ignore any abilities that would lessen their effect or ability to hit an opponent (Due to things like Water Absorb, Snow Cloak, Thick Fat, Sturdy, etc.)

items.name: Moody
items.description: At the end of each long rest, this Pokémon rerolls on the nature table, replacing its nature with the result until the next long rest.

items.name: Motor Drive
items.description: When hit by an electric-type move, if not immune, this Pokémon's speed increases by 10 feet until the end of combat (up to a max of 50 additional feet).

items.name: Moxie
items.description: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon may immediately take another action.

items.name: Multiscale
items.description: If this Pokémon is at full health, the first damage dealt to it is halved.

items.name: Multitype
items.description: This Pokémon's type and form change to match the type of Elemental Plate this Pokémon holds. The Plate cannot be effected by any item-removing ability or move.

items.name: Mummy
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, one random ability of its attacker changes to Mummy for the remainder of the encounter.

items.name: Mycelium Might
items.description: Once per short rest, when causing a creature to make a save that inflicts a status condition on failure, this Pokémon may invoke Mycelium Might to cause that creatre to roll the save with disadvantage.

items.name: Natural Cure
items.description: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.

items.name: Neuroforce
items.description: When this Pokémon damages a creature with a super effective move, it may roll the damage dice twice and use the higher result.

items.name: Neutralizing Gas
items.description: You are immune to poison damage and being poisoned.

items.name: No Guard
items.description: Any attack made by or against this Pokémon has advantage.

items.name: Normalize
items.description: Every move this Pokémon activates is Normal type.

items.name: Oblivious
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.

items.name: Opportunist
items.description: When the AC, STR, DEX, CON, INT, WIS, or CHA of a creature within 30ft of this Pokémon increases, then this Pokémon's corresponding attribute increases by the same amount. This effect lasts for the duration of battle, or for 1 minute.

items.name: Overcoat
items.description: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves and phenomena like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.

items.name: Overgrow
items.description: This Pokémon doubles its STAB bonus when it has 25% or less of its maximum health.

items.name: Overheat
items.description: This Pokémon knows Overheat as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

items.name: Own Tempo
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to becoming confused.

items.name: Paper Thin
items.description: This Pokémon always has a maximum HP of 1. (Shedinja only. Cannot be passed or swapped)

items.name: Pastel Veil
items.description: This Pokémon and its allies cannot be poisoned for as long as it is in combat.

items.name: Perish Body
items.description: When hit by a melee attack, this Pokémon and its attacker will faint in 3 rounds, at the start of their respective turn, unless fleeing or switched out by their trainer before the end of the three rounds.

items.name: Pickpocket
items.description: When hit by a melee attack, this Pokémon may use a reaction to attempt to steal the creature's held item with a Sleight of Hand check contested by the target's Passive Perception. After the first attempt, all other attempts against the same opponent are rolled at disadvantage.

items.name: Pickup
items.description: If an opponent uses a consumable held item in battle, this Pokémon gains a copy of it if it is not currently holding an item.

items.name: Pixilate
items.description: All of this Pokémon's normal-type moves become fairy-type.

items.name: Plus
items.description: This Pokémon boosts its attack and damage rolls by 2 if an ally also has a Plus or Minus ability

items.name: Poison Heal
items.description: This Pokémon does not suffer the disadvantage effects of the poisoned status. In addition, this Pokémon recovers half of all poison damage it would take, including the damage at each of the end of its turns.

items.name: Poison Point
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit with a melee attack, roll a 1d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of poison damage equal to this Pokémon’s proficiency modifier.

items.name: Poison Touch
items.description: On melee attacks made by this Pokémon, roll a d10 on a hit. On a result of a 10, the target is poisoned.

items.name: Power Construct (10%)
items.description: When Zygarde 10% is reduced to less than half of its maximum HP, it changes to Zygarde 50% Forme and recovers all hit points.

items.name: Power Construct (50%)
items.description: When Zygarde 50% is reduced to less than half of its maximum HP, it changes to Complete Forme and recovers all hit points.

items.name: Power Construct (100%)
items.description: When Zygarde is reduced to less than half of its maximum HP, it changes to Complete Forme and stays in that form, regardless of HP changes.

items.name: Power of Alchemy
items.description: When switched in after an ally faints, this Pokémon copies the non-hidden ability of the fainted ally until switched out.

items.name: Power Spot
items.description: Allies within 15 ft of this Pokemon may add 1d6 to damage they deal from moves. This die may only be used once per move per turn. At level 10, the bonus damage becomes 1d8 instead.

items.name: Prankster
items.description: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can move to the top of initiative order in a single round, but must use a status-affecting move on its turn.

items.name: Pressure
items.description: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly (non-area of effect moves) reduces its PP by two when activated.

items.name: Prism Armor
items.description: When this Pokémon is subject to damage in its vulnerabilities list, roll the damage dice twice and use the lower result for the damage calculation.

items.name: Propeller Tail
items.description: This Pokémon's ignores the effects of moves that alters the targets of its own moves (such as Follow Me).

items.name: Protean
items.description: This Pokémon's type changes to the type of move it uses, just before the move is used. It takes on the new type's resistances, vulnerabilities, and immunities.

items.name: Psychic Surge
items.description: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Psychic Terrain move as a bonus action.

items.name: Punk Rock
items.description: When this Pokémon uses a sound-based move, it adds its STAB bonus to the damage. This Pokémon has resistance to sound-based moves.

items.name: Pure Power
items.description: Once per short rest, this Pokémon may double the damage dice for a single damage roll. The player must announce that they are using this ability before the attack roll.

items.name: Purifying Salt
items.description: This Pokémon has resistance to Ghost-type damage, and it cannot be afflicted with non-volatile status conditions.

items.name: Quark Drive
items.description: While on electric terrain, gain +2 to STR and DEX ability checks and saving throws.

items.name: Queenly Majesty
items.description: Creatures within line of sight of this Pokémon cannot use bonus actions to activate Moves. Moves that would normally have a Move Time of "1 bonus action" instead have a Move Time of "1 action".

items.name: Quick Draw
items.description: This Pokémon has advantage on initiative rolls.

items.name: Quick Feet
items.description: When suffering from a negative status condition, this Pokémon’s speed increases by 15 ft.

items.name: Rain Dish
items.description: In rainy conditions, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency bonus at the end of each of its turns.

items.name: Rattled
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a damaging Dark, Bug, or Ghost move, it makes its next attack at advantage.

items.name: Receiver
items.description: When switched in after an ally faints, this Pokémon copies the non-hidden ability of the fainted ally until switched out.

items.name: Reckless
items.description: When attacking with moves with recoil damage, this Pokémon doubles its STAB bonus.

items.name: Refrigerate
items.description: All of this Pokémon's normal-type moves become ice-type.

items.name: Regenerator
items.description: Once per long rest, this Pokémon regains hit points equal to its level when it returns to its Pokéball.

items.name: Ripen
items.description: Doubles the effects of berries consumed.

items.name: Rivalry
items.description: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage when attacking a Pokémon of the same type.

items.name: RKS System
items.description: This Pokémon's type is determined by the memory disc it holds. If not holding a memory disc, this Pokémon's type is normal.

items.name: Rock Head
items.description: This Pokémon takes no recoil damage.

items.name: Rocky Payload
items.description: When this Pokémon uses a rock-type move, it may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Rough Skin
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, it may roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of typeless damage equal to its proficiency modifier to its attacker.

items.name: Run Away
items.description: This Pokémon cannot be the target of an attack of opportunity.

items.name: Sand Force
items.description: During a Sandstorm, this Pokémon can double its STAB when it hits an opponent.

items.name: Sand Rush
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to Sandstorm damage, and its speed is doubled in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.

items.name: Sand Spit
items.description: When this Pokémon takes damage, it may use its reaction to cause a Sandstorm centered on self with a radius of 30ft. The Sandstorm lasts for five rounds. The Pokémon may do this a number of times equal to its proficiency bonus, and it resets after a long rest.

items.name: Sand Stream
items.description: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to a Sandstorm for 5 rounds. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

items.name: Sand Veil
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to Sandstorm damage. In addition, its AC increases by 2 in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.

items.name: Sap Sipper
items.description: This Pokémon takes no damage from grass-type attacks. If hit by a grass type move, it takes no damage and instead absorbs the energy, granting advantage on its next attack.

items.name: Schooling
items.description: Beginning at level 5, this Pokémon may change to School Form as a free action when it begins its turn above 25% of its maximum health. In School Form, the Pokémon adds 5 to its AC and Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability scores (Additional CON does not alter this Pokemon's HP in this form). The Pokémon reverts back to Solo Form when it falls below 25% of maximum health, and must complete a short rest before activating this ability again.

items.name: Scrappy
items.description: This Pokémon's Normal and Fighting type moves ignore immunities granted by a Pokémon's type. If a target’s secondary type gives it vulnerability or resistance to the attack, it follows the secondary type for that effect.

items.name: Screen Cleaner
items.description: Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil have no effect within 40ft of this Pokémon.

items.name: Seed Sower
items.description: When hit by a damaging attack, this Pokémon may use its reaction to use the Grassy Terrain move. The Pokémon does not need to know this move, and it costs no PP to use.

items.name: Serene Grace
items.description: The Move DC to pass a saving throw against one of this Pokémon's moves is increased by 1.

items.name: Shadow Shield
items.description: If this Pokémon is at full health, the first damage dealt to it is halved.

items.name: Shadow Tag
items.description: Creatures within 50 feet of this Pokémon may not flee or switch out, except by item, Move, or ability.

items.name: Sharpness
items.description: Moves with 'Cut', 'Blade', 'Slash', 'Edge', 'Cleave', 'Razor', 'Sword', or 'Axe' in their name have their MOVE damage doubled.

items.name: Shed Skin
items.description: If this Pokémon is affected by a negative status ailment, they can roll a d4 at the end of each of their turns. On a result of 4, they are cured.

items.name: Sheer Force
items.description: When activating a move that has a chance to impose a stat change or inflict a status, this creature instead doubles its move modifier for the damage with no chance of the additional effect.

items.name: Shell Armor
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.

items.name: Shield Dust
items.description: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can ignore a negative status condition that results from an enemy move.

items.name: Shields Down
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to Non-Volatile status effects while in Meteor Form. When this Pokémon falls below 50% of its maximum hp, its outer shell breaks and it changes to Core Form. In Core Form, it adds 6 points to its DEX, but reduces its AC by 4. The Pokémon must complete a short rest to restore itself to Meteor Form.

items.name: Simple
items.description: Once per short rest, you may double this Pokémon's Move modifier for a single attack or damage roll.

items.name: Skill Link
items.description: Combo moves that have the ability to hit more than once, after the same attack roll, are guaranteed to hit at least twice. (Fury Swipes, Double Slap, Water Shuriken, etc.)

items.name: Slow Start
items.description: This Pokémon's speed is halved and its attacks are made at disadvantage for the first two rounds of every combat.

items.name: Slush Rush
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to Hail damage, and its speed is doubled in arctic conditions, or during a hailstorm.

items.name: Sniper
items.description: On a critical hit made by this Pokémon, triple the dice roll instead of doubling it.

items.name: Snow Cloak
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to Hail damage. It's AC is increased by 2 in arctic conditions, or when it is snowing or hailing.

items.name: Snow Warning
items.description: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to hail for 5 rounds. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

items.name: Solar Power
items.description: Damage rolls for this Pokémon get an additional +2 during harsh sunlight.

items.name: Solid Rock
items.description: This Pokémon does not take any additional damage from a critical hit.

items.name: Soul-Heart
items.description: Upon seeing an ally faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

items.name: Soundproof
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.

items.name: Speed Boost
items.description: This Pokémon's speed is increased by 10 feet while in an environment related to its type (DM Discretion).

items.name: Stakeout
items.description: When an opponent is switched out in battle, this Pokémon doubles the damage dealt if it targets the replacement on the first turn immediately following the switch.

items.name: Stall
items.description: This Pokémon is always last in initiative order.

items.name: Stalwart
items.description: This Pokémon may always choose its targets, ignoring the effects of moves that redirect targetting.

items.name: Stamina
items.description: When this Pokémon is damaged by a move, increase its AC by 2 until the start of its next turn. This ability does not stack and will remain in effect if the Pokémon is successfully attacked multiple turns in a row.

items.name: Stance Change
items.description: Aegislash has two forms. When Aegislash uses King's Shield, it changes to Shield Forme, swapping its AC and DEX stats. When it uses a damaging move, Aegislash immediately returns to Blade Forme, returning its stats to normal.

items.name: Static
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of electric damage equal to this Pokemon's proficiency bonus.

items.name: Steadfast
items.description: Once per long rest, when this Pokémon fails a saving throw against a negative condition, it can choose to pass instead.

items.name: Steam Engine
items.description: When damaged by a Fire- or Water-type move, this Pokémon's walking speed becomes double its base value until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Steelworker
items.description: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage dealt by steel-type moves.

items.name: Stench
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d10. On a 10, the attacker flinches.

items.name: Sticky Hold
items.description: Held items cannot be stolen or knocked away from this Pokémon.

items.name: Storm Drain
items.description: If this Pokemon or an ally within 30 feet is targeted with a direct water-type, damage-dealing move, the Pokemon may use a reaction to redirect the target to itself and take half damage from it if it hits.

items.name: Strong Jaw
items.description: For biting moves activated by this Pokémon (Bite, Thunder Fang, Crunch, etc.), they may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Sturdy
items.description: When taking damage equal to half or more of your current HP, roll a d4. On a result of 3 of 4, halve the damage dealt.

items.name: Suction Cups
items.description: This Pokémon cannot be forced out of battle by an opponent’s moves.

items.name: Super Luck
items.description: This Pokémon increases its critical hit range by 1 (20 to 19+, etc.)

items.name: Surge Surfer
items.description: When this Pokémon begins its turn in the area of effect from Electric Terrain, its speed is doubled.

items.name: Swarm
items.description: This Pokémon doubles its STAB bonus when it has 25% or less of its maximum health.

items.name: Sweet Veil
items.description: Any ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to the sleep condition.

items.name: Swift Swim
items.description: This Pokémon's speed is doubled in rainy conditions.

items.name: Symbiosis
items.description: This Pokémon may swap held items with an ally as a free action, as long as they are within 15 feet of each other.

items.name: Synchronize
items.description: If this Pokémon becomes burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, its attacker receives the negative status condition as well (if not immune).

items.name: Tangled Feet
items.description: Attacks against this Pokémon have disadvantage when it is confused.

items.name: Tangling Hair
items.description: Opponents within melee range of this Pokémon cannot take the Disengage action to move away.

items.name: Technician
items.description: For damaging moves activated by this Pokémon with 15 max PP or more, they may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Telepathy
items.description: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

items.name: Teravolt
items.description: This Pokémon’s moves completely ignore any ability that would hinder or prevent their effect on the target or the user's ability to hit the target.

items.name: Thick Fat
items.description: This Pokemon takes half the damage it otherwise would from Ice and Fire damage.

items.name: Tinted Lens
items.description: This Pokémon’s moves ignore resistances.

items.name: Torrent
items.description: This Pokémon doubles its STAB bonus when it has 25% or less of its maximum health.

items.name: Tough Claws
items.description: A successful melee attack by this Pokémon automatically gets STAB, regardless of its type. If it would normally get STAB, double the STAB bonus when adding to damage.

items.name: Toxic Boost
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a poison-type attack, its next attack is rolled at advantage.

items.name: Trace
items.description: This Pokémon copies a random ability of an opponent when entering battle. The ability cannot be Flower Gift, Forecast, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Trace, Wonder Guard, or Zen Mode.

items.name: Transformer
items.description: This Pokémon has a standard Normal form from which all stats are based, but may change forms as a bonus action to drastically change its abilities. The forms it can take are Attack, Defense, and Speed. In Attack form, it adds an additional +5 to its attack rolls, but all attacks against it has advantage. In Defense form, its AC increases by 3, but its attacks are rolled at disadvantage. If the activated move requires a save, the target(s) have advantage. In Speed form, it gains an additional attack action each turn, but the attack is done at disadvantage. If it is a move that requires a save, the target(s) have advantage.

items.name: Transistor
items.description: When this Pokémon uses an electric-type move, it may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

items.name: Triage
items.description: This Pokémon's healing or draining moves have a move time of 1 bonus action.

items.name: Truant
items.description: This Pokémon cannot use the same move in back to back rounds.

items.name: Turboblaze
items.description: This Pokémon’s moves completely ignore any ability that would hinder or prevent their effect on the target or the user's ability to hit the target.

items.name: Unaware
items.description: When this Pokémon attacks an opponent, it ignores any stat changes the opponent has been affected with after the start of battle.

items.name: Unburden
items.description: While this Pokémon is not holding an item, it gains 10 feet to its speed.

items.name: Unnerve
items.description: Opponents in combat with this Pokémon cannot eat held berries.

items.name: Unseen Fist
items.description: Melee attacks this Pokémon make may damage through the opponent's use of Protect or Detect.

items.name: Victory Star
items.description: While this Pokémon is in battle, all allied Pokémon add an additional +1 to their attack rolls.

items.name: Vital Spirit
items.description: This Pokémon cannot be put to sleep.

items.name: Volt Absorb
items.description: This Pokémon takes no damage from electricity or electric-type attacks. Instead, half of any electric damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.

items.name: Wandering Spirit
items.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, one random ability of its attacker changes to Wandering Spirit for the remainder of the encounter, and the replaced ability replaces this Pokémon's Wandering Spirit ability.

items.name: Water Absorb
items.description: This Pokémon takes no damage from water or water-type attacks. Instead, half of any water damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.

items.name: Water Bubble
items.description: This Pokémon is resistant to fire-type damage and immune to the burned condition.

items.name: Water Compaction
items.description: After being damaged by a water-type move, any other damage dealt to this Pokémon until the beginning of its next turn is halved.

items.name: Water Veil
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to burning.

items.name: Weak Armor
items.description: When an attack hits this Pokémon, its speed increases by 5 feet, but its AC is temporarily reduced by 1 until the end of battle (for a maximum reduction of -5).

items.name: Well-Baked Body
items.description: This Pokémon takes no damage from fire or fire-type attacks. Instead, its AC increases by 2 until it takes damage or after 1 minute, whichever happens first.

items.name: White Smoke
items.description: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.

items.name: Wimp Out
items.description: When a damaging move causes this Pokémon to fall below 50% of its maximum HP, it MUST disengage and move up to its speed in a straight line towards its trainer as a free action. If this would put the Pokémon in range of switching out, it must do so as another free action if another Pokémon is available to replace it.

items.name: Wind Power
items.description: When this Pokémon is damaged by a wind move, the number of damage dice used for its next electric-type attack doubles. Wind moves include Air Cutter, Bleakwind Storm, Blizzard, Fairy Wind, Gust, Heat Wave, Hurricane, Icy Wind, Petal Blizzard, Sandsear Storm, Sandstorm, Springtide Storm, Tailwind, Twister, Whirlwind, and Wildbolt Storm.

items.name: Wind Rider
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to damage dealt by wind moves. Additionally, this Pokémon's movement speed is double when moving with the wind's current direction, and halved when moving against the wind.

items.name: Wonder Guard
items.description: This Pokémon is immune to damaging attacks from types that are not in its vulnerabilities list. (Shedinja only. Cannot be passed or swapped)

items.name: Wonder Skin
items.description: This Pokémon has advantage on all saving throws against being burned, frozen, poisoned, or paralyzed.

items.name: Zen Mode
items.description: When Darmanitan is below 50% of its HP, it enters Zen Mode. In Zen Mode, Darmanitan changes into the form of a solid statue. It's type changes to Fire/Psychic, it gains +4 to its AC, and its STR and WIS ability scores are swapped.

items.name: Zen Mode (Galarian)
items.description: When Galarian Darmanitan is below 50% of its HP, it enters Zen Mode. In Zen Mode, Galarian Darmanitan changes into the form of a flaming snowman. It's type changes to Ice/Fire, it gains +4 to its AC, and its STR and WIS ability scores are swapped.

items.name: Zero to Hero
items.description: When a non-Pokémon ally of Palafin takes damage from a source outside that ally's control, Palafin may enter its Hero Form. In Hero Form, Palafin's size changes to Medium, its AC increases by 4, and each of its STR and DEX scores increase by 4, up to a maximum of 22. It may do this once per long rest. It reverts to normal form at the end of combat.
